result.execSummary:
The defendant Bradley A Senter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to count 3; credit for 120 days time served

miscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge during probation; failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered. Pay all mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges during probation; failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered. Court waive all non-mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges finding the defendant indigent.
Defendant informed he may not possess any firearms or dangerous weapons. Defendant informed he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been reinstated.
- Mental Health Assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to count 1; credit for 125 days time served

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bradley A Senter

records.addlTxt: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Bradley A Senter in court, in custody.  Attorney Allison Marie Ritter in court for Bradley A Senter.  Attorney Samuel E. Simpson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
AS TO COUNTS 1 and 3: 
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he/she is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he/she is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.

AS TO COUNT 2: Per plea negotiations and on State's motion, Court ordered dismissed and read in. 


Sentencing proceeds.  Statements made by the state, defense counsel and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1: 
Defendant sentenced to serve 150 days at the HOUSE OF CORRECTION, consecutive to Count 3. Credit for 120 days time served. COURT STAYS sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for a period of 1 year.

AS TO COUNT 3: 
Defendant sentenced to serve 150 days at the HOUSE OF CORRECTION, consecutive to Count 1. Credit for 125 days time served.  COURT STAYS sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for a period of 1 year.
.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION: 
-provide DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge during probation; failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered;
-pay all mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges during probation; failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered;
-Court waive all non-mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges finding the defendant indigent;
-mental health assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department;
-maintain work and/or school;
-no contact with L.D.J.

Defendant informed he may not posses any firearms or dangerous weapons.
Defendant informed he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been reinstated.

Appeal rights given. Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed. Copy given to defendant. -- gmb

ADJOURNED OFF THE RECORD.,
Case calendared for a  Plea and  Sentencing Hearing.
Court is in trial in on a different case and ordered this case adjourned.
New date confirmed with parties via email.
This hearing will be held before Judge Dee Branch 37 for Branch 19.
Plea and Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 21 at 11am/
and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights
Elements of the Offense
Due to rotation and the court being down on 10/14,  the plea and sentencing is rescheduled.  State and defense agreed to the date of 10/5/22 at 9 am.  MN

HELD OFF RECORD WITH APPROVAL OF JUDGE KIES. 

Off record discussions held. Due to Court congestion and availability case is adjourned.  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 6, Judge Ellen Brostrom, in Room 608 of the Courthouse. Parties notified.

Attorney Allison Marie Ritter in court, defendant Bradley A Senter not in court, in custody.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a scheduling conference. Defense requested a plea and sentencing hearing date. Case adjourned to Branch 45.
Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 6, Judge Ellen Brostrom, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Bradley A Senter in court with attorney Allison Marie Ritter.  William R. F. Ackell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a scheduling conference. Defense requested an additional scheduling conference date. Case adjourned to Branch 45.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Bradley A Senter in court with attorney Allison Marie Ritter.  Defendant Bradley A Senter in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Police Officer Benjamin Holsen. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 45.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Wagner.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Kies, Br. 45.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
filed.

Defendant Bradley A Senter in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Bradley A Senter in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bradley A Senter appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor counts 1 and 2.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
